sentences: Y'know… flashes of memories are starting to come back. It's like watching scenes from a movie I can't remember filming.<wait=1> I wasn't handling all this well, was I? How… how was my mental state?
Y-you needed to rest after jobs. It’s exhausting, no matter how experienced you are.
That’s not what I asked, Delta.
Yeah... Shit. Sorry.
I’m tired too, y'know? I’ve been looking for you for what feels like ages. You weren’t answering your phone, and I thought— I haven’t slept properly in days.
Taking a life… it does things to you. It’s what fucks up most people. Especially rookies.
It was hard for me, wasn’t it?
Honestly, no harder than it is for anyone starting out. I mean, everyone’s got that phase where the blood on their hands feels heavier.
But you— <wait=1>you were different. I figured that same spark that made you a star on stage would keep you going, help you push through.
I didn’t push through, did I?
Nobody really does, Blake. Not in the way we want to. But you learn to carry it. You learn to get better at... ignoring it. Just like every other job.
Then the jobs started being… different. It wasn’t just about getting something back. We started killing people like Santoro.
Oh, FUCK YOU.<wait=0.5> You knew damn well the office building was just a front. You knew what Santoro was doing, the shit he was into.
He was worse than all of us put together, Blake. That bastard was dealing in things even we wouldn’t touch.
Still had a family.
He killed more people than we ever did. He was a key player for that gang, a real monster.

We had to defend ourselves, Blake. He was stepping on our territory, messing with our shit. And don’t give me that innocent act. There wasn’t a single person in that office who didn’t have blood on their hands.
And I just wiped them out, like they were nothing. Like it was all just another part of the job.
It was never easy, Blake. None of it. But it was us or them. That’s how it’s always been. We don’t get the luxury of feeling sorry about it.
Is that what you told yourself every time? That it was us or them?
Fuck, yeah, that’s what I told myself. And you did too! Don’t fucking pretend like you didn’t.
You knew exactly what we were doing, and you didn’t give a shit. You loved it, didn’t you? The power, the thrill—it got you off just as much as the fucking heroin did!
